document_type: Final Determination Notification and Personnel Records
security: The text is redacted because the public disclosure of the redaction could reasonably be expected to constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, and that invasion of privacy would be so substantial that it outweighs the public interest.
summary: This document is a notification from the Assassination Records Review Board regarding the postponed release of certain information within HSCA staff payroll records, specifically social security numbers, to protect personal privacy.
summary_one_paragraph: The Assassination Records Review Board issued a final determination on December 8, 1995, regarding document number 180-10147-10257 from the HSCA staff payroll records. The document's status is 'Postponed in Part' due to privacy concerns, with two postponements related to the redaction of Social Security Numbers (SSN). The Board's decision balances the historical interest in the document against potential harm to individuals, concluding that releasing SSNs would constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy. The redacted text is replaced with 'SSN,' and the next review date is set for 2017.
title: Final Determination Notification Regarding HSCA Staff Payroll Records
